title: Abraham
summary: Abraham[lower-alpha 1] (originally Abram)[lower-alpha 2] is the common patriarch of the Abrahamic religions, including Judaism, Christianity, and Islam.[5] In Judaism he is the founding father of the special relationship between the Jews and God; in Christianity, he is the spiritual progenitor of all believers, Jewish or gentile (non-Jewish);[lower-alpha 3][6] and in Islam he is a link in the chain of prophets that begins with Adam and culminates in Muhammad.[4]
